title: League of Legends not that toxic?

replies.body: There is no such thing as toxicity. No one goes into a game thinking "I'm going to abuse my teammates for fun". People just get frustrated when they aren't winning.

i don't. As a Bronze 5 support main even if my adc is 0-12-1 with 4 farm at 20min I still keep calm and nice. I don't try to make big plays though and I roam a bit more to see what I can pick up, if they can manage under tower. Always try to work together and remember that no teammate is unworkable. If you can peel enough when trading or teamfighting, you'll get to see that beautiful damage lategame and sometimes people just get a bit tilted when they lose that first trade or first few cs. You just need to be considerate enough to help them get back into the pace of the game and they'll usually catchup and be extremely helpful in those last few teamfights.

Anyone can become tilted if your pace is wrong, even your normal csing becomes really hard to manage. If a teammate is getting frustrated you just need to show them that you're there to help and that the team believes in them and they can win if they focus more and take a few deep breaths. Support isn't just making plays or warding. You also give the team emotional and morale support as well.

You should always discourage abusive players though since they can upset the rest of the team and you should encourage them to take a more positive outlook. Sure the game isn't going well but we could still make a huge comeback and have alot of fun doing so. Don't afk, don't feed, we can do this. A comeback is always possible.
That said if you can't handle a really bad game, an honourable admission of defeat can often prevent people from tilting in their next game so if it really looks bleak it's ok to admit you lost.

Unfortunately mobas tend to have toxic communities. League especially due to the singular focus on ranked compared and the tendency of our community to compare each other. It's something you can't help. Everyone is stressed, trying their best, avoiding multiple deaths. The stressful environment can cause alot of people to just lose their heads so it's good to always encourage the people you play with and be friendly and funny and just make sure everyone enjoys themselves. 
Being Bronze 5 can be tough but in the end having fun is what's important. Summoners code is kinda corny though but just try to be nice with your teammates and even the enemy. Everyone is playing to have fun, there is no need to make people feel bad or get angry.

I honestly don't think it's as bad as people say. It's about equal to every other community I've seen. Competitive games always bring the worst out of people.

Well it's not as toxic as some make it out to be but the elements that are 'presented' there are a product of the competitive environment that is set up. Sure, the game is set up to be designed for both casual and dedicated players but overall a 40 minute average length game which requires not just your own skill but that of your entire teams can create a stress environment and not quite everyone has the tenacity and persistence to remain calm all the time. Even in normals I at times feel very frustrated with my own team when a hard earned victory lied ahead but instead we wound up with a basic throw where we all conveniently got picked off one a time at the worst possible point in a game leaving the enemy to take baron and steam roll a single lane and push to the nexus. 

I have no doubt you would see something similar in other MOBA's like maybe DOTA but hear it mainly in League because it's a much more popular game overall. I hear that Heroes of the Storm has taken steps to lower the frustration and toxicity but alas this would not prevent someone from being what we would call toxic.
